line: The Red Ribbon Express (RRE) is the world’s largest mass
label: paragraph

line: mobilisation drive on HIV/AIDS. The train will travel
label: paragraph

line: through 22 states, during its one year long journey, halting
label: paragraph

line: at 152 stations. Through the RRE, NACO, intends to break
label: paragraph

line: the silence surrounding the issue of HIV/AIDS, by taking
label: paragraph

line: the messages on prevention, care and support to people
label: paragraph

line: living in small towns and villages across the country. The
label: paragraph

line: aim is also to create an environment, free from stigma
label: paragraph

line: and discrimination faced by people living with HIV, so they
label: paragraph

line: can access the services, without fear and prejudice, and
label: paragraph

line: live a life of dignity. It has proved to be a successful multi-
label: paragraph

line: sectoral initiative, of the NACO and a powerful advocacy
label: paragraph

line: tool, both at the state and district level, besides enhancing
label: paragraph

line: local capacity to deal with HIV prevention.
label: paragraph

line: Radio programmes: Three radio programmes in
label: paragraph

line: Hindi – “Babli Boli”, “5 Down Mohabbat Express”
label: paragraph

line: and “Kitne Door, Kitne Pass” were launched by
label: paragraph

line: NACO, targeting rural women, rural youth and
label: paragraph

line: urban migrants respectively. The programmes
label: paragraph

line: were aired for six months from September,
label: paragraph

line: 2009 to March, 2010. The duration of the each
label: paragraph

line: episode was half an hour and two episodes
label: paragraph

line: of each programme were aired every week.
label: paragraph

line: The programmes were linked to the ground
label: paragraph

line: mobilisation in 21 vulnerable districts, in the
label: paragraph

line: states of UP, Bihar, Rajasthan, MP and Delhi
label: paragraph

line: through 100 Radio Listener Clubs formed in each
label: paragraph

line: of these districts. The radio clubs promoted not
label: paragraph

line: only listenership of the programmes, but also
label: paragraph

line: helped in further dissemination of messages in
label: paragraph

line: the communities. The SACS also produce and air
